shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say
shorts.title_distilled: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, Pa. (WNEP) - Two women were killed and another was hospitalized from a machete attack in Pennsylvania. Police in Scranton said they are still investigating the machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn apartments on Tuesday night. Two women and a service d…
shorts.content: SCRANTON, Pa. (WNEP) - Two women were killed and another was hospitalized from a machete attack in Pennsylvania. Police in Scranton said they are still investigating the machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn apartments on Tuesday night. Two women and a service d…

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 10, 2026
shorts.description: Carbondale Cash bingo: Trinity Episcopal Church, 58 River St., cash bingo, Jan. 25, $1,000 grand prize, $25/admission ticket includes 10 regular games with a $100 prize, jackpot and special boards are sold separately. Doors open at 1:30 p.m. Games start at 2:30; 50/50, lottery wheel raffle and door prize, snack bar available. Stop by weekdays 9 a.m.-1 p.m. for tickets or purchase online at www.trinity-episcopal.weebly.com; church office, 570-282-3620. Dickson City Reorganization meeting: Dickson City Decorative Light and Banner Association annual reorganization meeting, Jan. 28, borough building, 901 Enterprise St. The meeting, open to all residents of Dickson City and scheduled […]
shorts.content: Carbondale Cash bingo: Trinity Episcopal Church, 58 River St., cash bingo, Jan. 25, $1,000 grand prize, $25/admission ticket includes 10 regular games with a $100 prize, jackpot and special boards are sold separately. Stop by weekdays 9 a.m.-1 p.m. for tickets or purchase online at www.trinity-episcopal.weebly.com; church office, 570-282-3620. shorts.title: Scranton Prep Magis Scholarship winners achieved scores in the top 35
shorts.title_distilled: Scranton Prep Magis Scholarship winners achieved scores in the top 35.
shorts.description: Scranton Prep’s 2025 Entrance Exam Scholarship winners celebrated their achievement over breakfast at Prep on Dec. 17. Prep awarded scholarships to the top 35 scores out of over 250 test takers. Magis Scholarship winners achieved scores in the top 35. Pictured, top row, from left: Kristin Cupillari, Scranton Prep principal; Lucas Yeager, St. Clare/St. Paul; Matthew Carlson, Western Wayne; Nicholas Bonczkiewicz, Lakeland; Ronan Keating, St. Clare/St. Paul; Ellie Wargo, Riverside; Cassie Sheehan, Our Lady of Peace; Emily Vodzak, Our Lady of Peace; Ethan Murray, St. Clare/St. Paul; and the Rev. A.J. Rizzo, S.J., Scranton Prep president. Seated: Joseph Haggerty, St. […]

shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, January 10, 2026
shorts.description: PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Mary Ellen Krenitsky, contingent trustee of the Stella Krenitsky Irrevocable Personal Residence Trust Agreement, to Damian Rosado, Garfield, N.J.; a property at 968 Wood St., Old Forge, for $252,350. Sean A. and Kaitlin B. Byrne, Archbald, to Deborah B. Yearing and Kristen Yearing, Scranton, as joint tenants with rights of survivorship; a property at 231 Cherry St., Jessup, for $320,000. APS Property LLC, South Abington Twp., to Ruchiben K. and Kirtankumar P. Patel, Scranton; a property at 1028-1030 Madison Ave., Scranton, for $306,000. shorts.title: Viewmont Mall to reopen after gas leak evacuation
shorts.title_distilled: Viewmont Mall to reopen after gas leak evacuation.
shorts.description: LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — The Viewmont Mall will reopen Friday after closing and evacuating Thursday night due to a gas leak. Viewmont Mall Property Manager Associate Rosemary Bohenek said the mall will open for business at 11:00 a.m. Friday. However, some stores currently do not have power, but should have power back Saturday morning To [...]
shorts.content: LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — The Viewmont Mall will reopen Friday after closing and evacuating Thursday night due to a gas leak. Viewmont Mall Property Manager Associate Rosemary Bohenek said the mall will open for business at 11:00 a.m. Friday. However, some stores currently do not have power, but should have power back Saturday morning To [...]
shorts.content_distilled: LACKAWANNA COUNTY  — The Viewmont Mall will reopen Friday after closing and evacuating Thursday night due to a gas leak.
